intro: Broussaisia pellucida, commonly known as the white-flowered broussaisia, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Broussaisia pellucida is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
